author: Jason Gay
title: Is an Upscale Uniform the Future of Office Fashion?
text:
I’ve long been fascinated by what fashion people call a “uniform”—not a uniform-uniform, like a baseball or military outfit—but a specific, everyday look that almost never wavers. You know, like Steve Jobs in his blue Levi’s and black mock turtleneck, or Mark Zuckerberg with those gray T-shirts and hoodies that make the Facebook CEO resemble a freshly hired temp.
Even when the look is casual, a uniform can be a serious life commitment. I once stayed in a home where I discovered, upon opening the master-bedroom closet, that...
